intro: Amphilophis leucopogon, commonly known as the white-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and succulent stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Amphilophis leucopogon is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, coastal or inland regions.
